summary: the genome comprises a 5' untranslated region (UTR); a 3' UTR; at least seven open reading frames (ORFs) that encode four structural proteins, namely, spike (S), envelope (E), membrane (M), and nucleocapsid (N); and three non-structural proteins, namely, replicases 1a and 1ab. the PEDV S protein is a type I glycoprotein composed of 1,383 amino acids (aa) pigs of all ages were affected and exhibited watery diarrhea, dehydration, and thin-walled intestines. pigs of all ages were affected and exhibited mild diarrhea and anorexia. the S protein of the YJ7C strain contained 28 Asn-Xaa-Ser/Thr sequons and 22 asparagines predicted to be N-glycosylated. the S protein of the YJ7C strain contained 29 Asn-Xaa-Ser/Thr sequons and 23 asparagines predicted to be N-glycosylated. strain may influence pathogenicity and antigenicity. strain may influence pathogenicity and antigenicity and should be researched. the highest DNA sequence identity to our PEDV strains was CH8 (one Chinese PEDV strain), which had 98.4% identity. the nucleotide sequence of our PEDV strains had only 93.8% to 93.9% identity to the CV777 vaccine strain. their deduced amino acids had 93.6% to 93.7% from our study. one mutation (LH at 521) was also found in all the five PEDV strains from our study. however, no mutations were found in the five PEDV strains from our study. the variant strains were detected in this study, implying an identical distribution profile for PEDV on pig farms in Gansu, china. the sequence insertions and deletions in the S gene and mutations in the antigenic regions found in variant strains possibly provided stronger pathogenicity and antigenicity to the new PEDV variants. four (from N to V at 57, from N to I at 127, from T to I at 232, and from N to S at 719) of the changes in the predicted amino acid sequence destroyed N-linked glycosylation sites. another three changes (from S to N at 58, from I to T at 116, and from T to N at 1193) created three new glycosylation sites compared with the vaccine strain CV777. changes in the N-linked glycosylation sites nucleotide and deduced amino acid sequence homology results are described in Table 1. the from Japan (MK) the five variant strains from our study (JY5C, JY6C, JY7C, YJ3F, and YJ7C) shared a 4-aa insertion (at positions 56–59 of the S protein), 1-aa insertion (at position 140 of the S protein), and 2-a compared with the vaccine strain CV777, eight mutations (AS at 517, SG at 523, VI at 527, TS at 549, GS at 594, AE at 605, LF at 612, and IV at 635) were found in all the five PEDV strains from our study. no mutations were found in the five PEDV strains from our study. compared with the vaccine strain CV777, no mutations were found in the neutralizing epitopes SS2 and 2C10. samples were collected individually and placed in separate sterile specimen containers. the suspensions were vortexed and centrifuged for 10 min at 10,000 g. the supernatants were stored at 80 °C before use. pig samples were positive for PEDV by RT-PCR. a full-length S gene was excised and synthesized using a QIAquick Gel Extraction Kit. phylogenetic trees were constructed using molecular evolutionary genetics analysis MegAlign version 5.0 [17] with the neighbor-joining method to calculate distance. phylogenetic trees were constructed using molecular evolutionary genetics analysis MegAlign version 5.0 [17] with the neighbor-joining method to calculate distance. sample collection A total of 17 samples (fecal and intestinal) were collected from seven dead piglets showing signs of watery diarrhea and dehydration. the suspensions were vortexed and centrifuged for 10 min at 10,000 g. RT was carried out using random hexamer primers (TaKaRa Bio Inc., Otsu, Japan) and the cDNA was immediately amplified with primers. the RT-PCR products were analyzed by 1.5% agarose gel electrophoresis. five PEDV S gene sequences were aligned with 32 previously published PEDV S genes. phylogenetic trees were constructed using molecular evolutionary genetics analysis MegAlign version 5.0. china 2012 YJ7C KF177255 China 2012 YJ3F KF177257 China 2012 YJ7C KF177258 China 2012 CH1 JQ239429 China 2011 CH3 JQ239431 China 2011 CH4 JQ239432 China 2011 CH5 JQ239433 China 2011 CH6 JQ239434 China 2011 CH7 JQ239435 China 2011 CH8 JQ239436 China 2011 CHGD01 JN980698 China 2011 CH-F inability to amplify virus from all piglets might impact our results. piglets may have coinfections that might skew our results. piglets may have coinfections that might skew our results.
